analytic.title: Quand un mot grec est révélé par le latin et le syriaque: κατάδρομον

monogr.title: Bulletin de la Société de linguistique de Paris

biblStruct.note: A Greek noun κατάδρομος seems to have existed, but it is never attested in Greek literature, classical or late. Its only use mentioned in dictionaries is in Latin, in the Life of Nero by Suetonius, where it seems to refer to a rope for tightrope walker. It turns out that the word is also attested in Syriac, also in the context of games, in historiographical texts (Chronicle of the Pseudo-Diocles and Chronicle of Malalas) and with a different meaning in the Cave of Treasures, about the expulsion of Adam and Eve from paradise.
